column3: Relational databases store data in tables.
SQL is a programming language used to create and manage databases.
Which of the following is a type of database?
column6: a) Python b) NoSQL c) HTML d) XML

column3: Which SQL statement is used to retrieve data from a database?
column6: a) SELECT b) UPDATE c) DELETE d) INSERT

column3: The unique identifier for a record in a database table is called the __.
Foreign keys are used to enforce relationships between tables.
A database index speeds up the retrieval of rows by using a data structure.
Which of these is a database management system?
column6: a) Linux b) Apache c) Java d) MySQL

column3: Which SQL clause is used to filter results?
column6: a) JOIN b) GROUP BY c) WHERE d) ORDER BY

column3: A database schema defines the __ of a database.
Normalization reduces redundancy in a database.
A transaction in a database is a single unit of work.
What does ACID stand for in database systems?
column6: a) Availability Consistency Isolation Durability b) Atomicity Consistency Isolation Durability c) Accessibility Consistency Isolation Durability d) Atomicity Consistency Integrity Durability

column3: Which of these is a type of database relationship?
column6: a) One-to-Many b) One-to-One c) Many-to-Many d) All of the above

column3: The command to add a new row to a table in SQL is __.
